node.text:
Photo by @j.snow_photo
•
 ~Helms Deep~

Like the Fortress Hornburg in the Valley of Helms Deep, tucked into the white mountains of middle earth in Tolkien’s “Lord of the Rings”, Mount Gould and the Angels Wing overlook this incredible valley nestled into the Rocky Mountains of @glaciernps .

•

node.text:
Photo by @joey.visual 
•
I would say this is a perfect way to end our trip at Glacier NP. A mild hike with a nice sunset and some beautiful wildflowers - couldn't ask for more! 
Pleasure from simplicity is the true happiness in life ❤️

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Glacier_National_Park 🦋 in Glacier National Park with @glaciernps, and @mc_photography406. May be an image of tree, nature and mountain.
Photo by Glacier_National_Park 🦋 in Glacier National Park with @didoyamulka, and @glaciernps. May be an image of flower and nature.

node.text:
Photo by @didoyamulka 
•
I have learnt over time that the photo is where the light is at. As some of you can recognize that I made this image far away from the main destination which this trail leads to. Halfway into the hike I knew I could not make it to the viewpoint and also this light seemed too good to pass for something else.

In my frantic search for frames, I found these asters right next to the boardwalk and they allowed me to create a composition without stepping on the fragile vegetation. So there I was lying flat on the boardwalk, on my chest, extending my camera to take multiple shots in order to achieve focus throughout. 

As is the case with visitors to any park these days, people soon started flocking to see what animal I was shooting and were disappointed to know that there were no bighorn or grizzlies on that meadow. With the emergence of travel in recent years, visitors to these parks have become extremely demanding in terms of wanting to see these animals during their time in the park. In their bid to see wild animals, people take drastic measures, forget common courtesy, and even compromise their and other’s safety from time to time. I will not understand their plight, the same way they will not understand my fascination with side-lit mountains. 

Let us all enjoy the parks in our own ways. Let’s be less aggressive with nature and other humans when visiting these parks. 
•••
••
•

node.accessibility_caption: Photo shared by Glacier_National_Park 🦋 on August 10, 2021 tagging @horoho_, @glaciernps, and @montanaknifecompany. May be an image of text that says 'MKC MONTANA KNIFE CO.'.

node.text:
THE WINNER OF OUR BLACKFOOT 2.0 KNIFE GIVEAWAY IS @masoncas CONGRATULATIONS AND PLEASE DM @montanaknifecompany FOR SHIPPING INFO!! 💯💯 KNIFE GIVEAWAY with @montanaknifecompany
•
Montana Strong, Supporting Small Businesses in Montana!
•
We’re teaming up with Montana Knife Company (again 🙌🏼) for an incredible giveaway!
They are a high end knife company based out of Frenchtown, Montana. Owned and operated by Master Bladesmith Josh Smith. 100% USA Made 🇺🇸 Josh has over 30 years of knife making experience under his belt!
Working knives for working people!
••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••

There will be One winner and the winner will receive a MKC “Blackfoot 2.0” Knife (valued at $300) 
Blackfoot 2.0 is the knife every hiker wants!
••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••

To enter for a chance to win: 

1. Tag a friend OR leave the comment “MKC”
2. MUST Follow @montanaknifecompany and @glacier_national_park
3. Optional - tag as many friends as you like and those additional tags mean more chances to win!
••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••

Giveaway ends August 13, 2021 and will be announced on August 14th.
•
The winner will be posted here on this post and in our stories!
The winners will be randomly selected by @montanaknifecompany
•
Good luck everyone and 
it is for USA ONLY 🇺🇸
(Due to high shipping prices)

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Glacier_National_Park 🦋 in Glacier National Park with @glaciernps, and @coltons_captures. May be an image of nature.

node.text:
Photo by @coltons_captures 
•
Not every day do you get to see a double rainbow, especially with this kind of backdrop. I had just done a 7 hour drive up to Glacier from Stanley, ID and my original plan was just to set up camp early that night and get some rest for a big day in the park the next day. When my first couple spots I had scoped out for camp were already taken I debated on what I should do. There were intermittent showers all afternoon with peeks of sunshine and I thought to myself “maybe I should head into the park, I might get a shot at a rainbow”. Sure enough, the first grand turn of the going-to-the-sun-road I’ll be damned if there wasn’t one, but 2 rainbows! I ended up sleeping in a parking lot in town that night, but it was well worth the grand show Mother Nature put on for me.
•••
••
•
